of your geometry and then you use the Shader to shade in what color that pixel should be and a GPU is basically a
hardware implemented restorer it's a 3D engine in itself but there's also Ray
tracing that's where you trace the light from your eye or your camera into the
screen screen into the scene and you see how that bounces off all the objects and into the lights and that way you can
create physical based um lighting and shading and rendering and it creates
really really realistic images up until recently it wasn't that common in demo effects because all demo
effects are real time and real time rate tracing wasn't really
uh feasible until Nvidia released their first rate race capable gpus and now we

paths you are tracing invisible spheres into the space and you see if those
spheres intersect your geometry by doing what's known as distance estimation so
